It's super easy and the pickles will keep in the refrigerator for months.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/10/quick-pickled-peppers-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/10/quick-pickled-peppers-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/10/quick-pickled-peppers-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/10/quick-pickled-peppers-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-pickled-peppers-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["&frac12; pound jalape\u00f1os (choose larger jalape\u00f1os for less spicy pickles)", "1 red bell pepper", "1 cup apple cider vinegar (or white wine vinegar or distilled white vinegar)", "1 cup water", "2 tablespoons honey or sugar of choice", "2 cloves garlic, peeled and smashed", "1 teaspoon salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, prepare your peppers: Wear gloves to prevent your fingers from feeling burned. For less spicy pickles, use a paring knife to remove the jalape\u00f1o membranes and seeds before slicing (this is a lot of work, so I just pulled out the larger membranes from my sliced pickles). Slice the pickles thin with a mandoline or chef&#8217;s knife. If you&#8217;re still concerned about the spice level of the pickles, run the sliced jalape\u00f1os under running water in a colander to try to knock off any remaining seeds. (Beware, those pepper fumes made me cough.) Slice off the top of the bell pepper and remove the seeds and membranes. Chop the bell pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-pickled-peppers-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the prepared peppers and smashed garlic in a 28-ounce (1.75 pints) or larger glass jar. In a small saucepan, combine the vinegar, water, honey and salt. Bring the mixture close to a boil on the stove, stirring occasionally to dissolve the sweetener into the liquid. Remove from heat and carefully pour the liquid over the peppers. Use a butter knife to poke down the peppers so they all fit and there aren&#8217;t any hidden air pockets.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-pickled-peppers-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the pickles cool to room temperature in the jar, then screw on a lid and refrigerate the pickles. Depending on how thinly you sliced the peppers, they could be ready to eat immediately or might need a couple of days in the refrigerator before they taste fully pickled (just sample one every now and then to find out!). They are best when relatively fresh, but keep well for at least a month.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-pickled-peppers-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": Transfer the toasted almonds to a bowl to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-cauliflower-rice-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Return the skillet to the heat and add the olive oil and garlic. Cook while stirring until the garlic is fragrant, about 10 to 20 seconds. Add the cauliflower rice, red pepper flakes and salt, and stir to combine. Cook, stirring just every minute or so, until the cauliflower rice is hot and turning golden in places, about 6 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-cauliflower-rice-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the skillet from the heat. Stir to combine, and raise the heat to high to bring the mixture to a simmer. Once simmering, reduce heat to medium-low and cook for about 35 minutes, until almost all of the liquid has been absorbed and the oats are nice and creamy. Stir every five minutes in the beginning, and more frequently as time goes on (you might need to dial down the heat as well).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/apple-steel-cut-oatmeal-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from heat and let the oatmeal rest for 5 minutes before serving so it has more time to thicken up. If you&#8217;re saving extra portions for later, let them cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate for up to 4 days. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Mediterranean Spaghetti Squash Bowls", "description": "Roasted spaghetti squash topped with your favorite Mediterranean ingredients and pesto! This healthy vegetarian dinner recipe will make everyone happy. Recipe yields 4 servings (4 stuffed spaghetti squash halves).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 spaghetti squash", "2 tablespoons + 1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained, or 1 &frac12; cups cooked chickpeas", "1 red bell pepper, chopped", "&#8531; cup chopped red onion (about &frac12; small onion)", "&frac14; cup thinly sliced Kalamata olives", "2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil and/or parsley, plus extra for garnish", "1 clove garlic, pressed or minced", "1 tablespoon lemon juice", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "Sprinkle of crumbled feta cheese or grated Parmesan (optional), for garnish", "&frac14; cup pepitas (hulled pumpkin seeds)*", "&frac12; cup packed fresh basil leaves", "&frac12; cup packed fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves", "2 tablespoons lemon juice", "2 tablespoons water", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "&frac14; cup extra-virgin olive oil"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the spaghetti squash, preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy clean-up. Use a very sharp chef&#8217;s knife to cut off the tip-top and very bottom ends of each spaghetti squash. Stand the squash upright on a stable surface and slice through it from top to bottom to divide it in half. Repeat with the other squash.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a large spoon to scoop out the spaghetti squash seeds and discard them. Drizzle each squash half with 1 teaspoon olive oil and rub it all over the inside and outside of the squash, adding more oil if necessary. Sprinkle salt and pepper lightly over the interiors of the squash, then place them cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 40 to 60 minutes, until the interiors are easily pierced through with a fork.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, to prepare the chickpea salad, combine the chickpeas, bell pepper, onion, olives, chopped basil and/or parsley, garlic, lemon juice, remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and salt. Stir to combine. Taste, and add more lemon juice and/or salt if necessary. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the pesto: In a small skillet, toast the pepitas over medium heat, stirring often, until they are fragrant and making little popping noises, about 5 minutes. Pour the pepitas into a food processor and let them cool for a few minutes. Then, add the basil, parsley, lemon juice, water and salt. Process while slowly drizzling in the olive oil, stopping to scrape down the sides as necessary, until the pepitas have broken down to create a pretty smooth sauce. Transfer the pesto to a small bowl for serving.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mediterranean-spaghetti-squash-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble, use a fork to fluff up the squash and make it easier to eat. Then divide the chickpea salad between the squash &#8220;bowls&#8221; and top each one with a generous drizzle of pesto. Finish with a sprinkle of chopped herbs and cheese, if desired. Serve immediately. Scrub the potatoes and cut them, lengthwise, into 10 to 12 even wedges. The trick is to first quarter the potatoes lengthwise, and then cut each quarter lengthwise into 2 to 3 wedges (I sliced mine a little too thin).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-baked-french-fries/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the sliced potatoes into a large bowl and cover them with hot water (I used hot water from the tap, but others have suggested that pipes can leach impurities into hot water, so it may be best to use cool tap water that has been heated on the stove). Let them soak for 10 minutes. This step releases some of the starch in the potatoes and lets them absorb moisture, which leads to crisp outsides and moist interiors.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-baked-french-fries/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Drizzle &frac14; cup oil onto the paper, then sprinkle it evenly with about &frac12; teaspoon salt and &frac14; teaspoon pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-baked-french-fries/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drain the potatoes and pat them dry thoroughly with a tea towel or paper towels. Toss the potatoes with the remaining 1 teaspoon oil and mix evenly.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-baked-french-fries/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange the fries in a single layer on a baking sheet and cover the sheet tightly with foil. Bake for 5 minutes, then remove the foil and continue to bake for 10 minutes. Rotate the pan and cook another 5 to 10 minutes, until the underside of the potatoes are spotty golden brown.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-baked-french-fries/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the baking sheet from the oven and scrape the fries loose with a spatula. Then use tongs or the spatula to flip over each wedge. Arrange them in an even layer and put them back in the oven to bake until the fries are golden and crisp, about 5 to 10 minutes longer. Recipe as written below yields about 2 cups (16 ounces) sauce.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "homemade enchilada sauce", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/04/homemade-enchilada-sauce-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/04/homemade-enchilada-sauce-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/04/homemade-enchilada-sauce-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/04/homemade-enchilada-sauce.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/enchilada-sauce-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons olive oil", "3 tablespoons flour (whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour and gluten-free flour blends all work!)", "1 tablespoon ground chili powder (scale back if you&#8217;re sensitive to spice or using particularly spicy chili powder)", "1 teaspoon ground cumin", "\u00bd teaspoon garlic powder", "\u00bc teaspoon dried oregano", "\u00bc teaspoon salt, to taste", "Pinch of cinnamon (optional but recommended)", "2 tablespoons tomato paste", "2 cups vegetable broth", "1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar or distilled white vinegar", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "This sauce comes together quickly once you get started, so measure the dry ingredients (the flour, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, salt and optional cinnamon) into a small bowl and place it near the stove. Place the tomato paste and broth near the stove as well.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/enchilada-sauce-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium-sized pot over medium heat, warm the oil until it&#8217;s hot enough that a light sprinkle of the flour/spice mixture sizzles on contact. This might take a couple of minutes, so be patient and don\u2019t step away from the stove!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/enchilada-sauce-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once it&#8217;s ready, pour in the flour and spice mixture. While whisking constantly, cook until fragrant and slightly deepened in color, about 1 minute. Whisk the tomato paste into the mixture, then slowly pour in the broth while whisking constantly to remove any lumps.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/enchilada-sauce-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Raise heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook, whisking often, for about 5 to 7 minutes, until the sauce has thickened a bit and a spoon encounters some resistance as you stir it. (The sauce will thicken some more as it cools.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/enchilada-sauce-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from heat, then whisk in the vinegar and season to taste with a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper. Add more salt, if necessary (I usually add another pinch or two). Thank you!!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Inge"}, "datePublished": "2024-12-04", "reviewBody": "I love the balanced taste of this frosting. Not too sweet. However, my frosting was so runny I could pour it. So I did some research. Turns out European cream cheese contains a lot more water than American cream cheese. The sugar draws out the water and runny frosting is the result. No problems with lumpy sugar though. A possible answer is to first bind the sugar with butter and then add the cream cheese. I think you may need more butter though. Or search for a recipe specific for European cream cheese."}], "datePublished": "2019-06-14", "@id": "https://cookieandkate.com/cream-cheese-frosting-recipe/#recipe", "isPartOf": {"@id": Recipe yields 20 to 24 small toasts.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "tomato basil bruschetta", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/08/tomato-bruschetta-with-balsamic-drizzle-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/08/tomato-bruschetta-with-balsamic-drizzle-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/08/tomato-bruschetta-with-balsamic-drizzle-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/08/tomato-bruschetta-with-balsamic-drizzle.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tomato-basil-bruschetta-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 pounds ripe tomatoes (about 5 to 6 medium tomatoes, but any variety will work)", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt, plus more to taste", "&frac12; cup finely chopped white onion (about &frac12; medium)", "&frac12; cup chopped fresh basil (about &frac34; ounce)", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "1 baguette (French bread)", "4 to 5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "Thick balsamic vinegar (see notes within post) and optional Maldon flaky sea salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven (or a gas grill*) to 450 degrees Fahrenheit. Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy clean-up, if desired. If your baking sheet is smaller than mine, you may need to make the toast in two batches.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tomato-basil-bruschetta-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dice your tomatoes and transfer them to a medium mixing bowl, leaving the tomato seeds and juice behind on the cutting board. Stir the salt into the tomatoes, and add the onion, basil and garlic as they are ready. Stir to combine and set the mixture aside to marinate while you work on the bread.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tomato-basil-bruschetta-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice your baguette on the diagonal into pieces no wider than &frac12;-inch (see photos). I can usually fit 20 to 24 slices on my large baking sheet; you might have some bread left over. Lightly brush both sides of each slice with olive oil (this will require about 2 to 3 tablespoons oil).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tomato-basil-bruschetta-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the slices in a single layer on your prepared baking sheet and bake them on the middle rack for 6 to 9 minutes, until they&#8217;re crisp and nicely golden on top. Transfer the toasts to a serving platter(s), if desired, and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tomato-basil-bruschetta-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When you&#8217;re ready to serve, carefully drain off the excess tomato juice that has accumulated in the bowl, using your hand as a stopgap. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Stir to combine, and season the mixture with additional salt, to taste (I usually add another &frac14; to &frac12; teaspoon). If you don&#8217;t feel like your bruschetta is garlicky enough (I like mine lightly but not overwhelmingly garlicky), add another pressed clove of garlic.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tomato-basil-bruschetta-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Top each toast with tomato mixture, tipping your spoon against the bowl to release excess juice as necessary. Add the eggs and whisk until blended. (If your coconut oil solidifies on contact with cold ingredients, simply let the bowl rest in a warm place for a few minutes, like on top of your stove, or warm it for about 10 seconds in the microwave.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-pumpkin-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the pumpkin pur\u00e9e, milk, pumpkin spice, baking soda, vanilla and salt, and whisk to blend. Lastly, switch to a big spoon and stir in the flour, just until combined. Some lumps are ok! If you&#8217;re adding any additional mix-ins, gently fold them in now.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-pumpkin-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the batter into your greased loaf pan and sprinkle lightly with cinnamon. Rinse and drain the berries and pick through to remove any stems still attached. If you&#8217;re using strawberries, slice them into &frac14;-inch thick pieces. If you&#8217;re using particularly large blackberries, slice them in half.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mixed-berry-crisp-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a 9 by 9-inch baking dish, mix together the berries, honey, starch, citrus zest and juice. Mix in the butter and yogurt. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Refreshing Hibiscus Mocktail", "description": "Looking for a not-too-sweet mocktail recipe? This sparkling non-alcoholic hibiscus drink is just the ticket! It's colorful, festive, and simple to make. Recipe yields 4 medium (12-ounce) drinks. Multiply as necessary, or double it to make a big pitcher (combine just when you're ready to serve).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/07/sparkling-hibiscus-mocktail-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/07/sparkling-hibiscus-mocktail-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/07/sparkling-hibiscus-mocktail-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/07/sparkling-hibiscus-mocktail-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/hibiscus-mocktail-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 bags of hibiscus tea or 1 tablespoon loose hibiscus tea (I used Tazo&#8217;s &#8220;Passion&#8221; blend)", "3 cups (24 ounces) water", "2 small limes (about 4 tablespoons lime juice), plus lime rounds for garnish", "Topo Chico or other sparkling water or club soda", "Ice, for serving", "2 tablespoons honey", "2 tablespoons water"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the tea component, heat the water to a low simmer, either in a tea pot or in a saucepan on the stovetop. Steep the tea in the hot water for 3 minutes, then remove the bags (or strain off the loose tea). Set the tea aside to cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/hibiscus-mocktail-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the honey syrup: Combine equal parts honey and water (say, 2 tablespoons each if you\u2019re only making one batch of drinks) in a microwave-safe bowl or small saucepan. Warm in the microwave or over the stovetop just until you can completely stir the honey into the water. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/hibiscus-mocktail-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When you&#8217;re ready to serve, fill four medium glasses with ice. Fill each halfway with hibiscus tea. Top each with about a tablespoon of lime juice and 1 teaspoon of the honey simple syrup, and stir to combine. Fill the rest of each glass with sparkling water, gently stirring afterward to combine. You may want to adjust to taste by using less lime juice or more simple syrup\u2014totally up to you! I've been sharing recipes here on Cookie and Kate since 2010, and I'm always cooking something new in my Kansas City kitchen. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Raspberry Hand Pies with Cinnamon-Orange Glaze", "description": "These handheld raspberry-orange treats feature delicious maple flavor and a touch of warming cinnamon. The whole grain dough is remarkably crisp and flaky. You can use it to make full-sized pies, too!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/10/raspberry-hand-pies-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/10/raspberry-hand-pies-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/10/raspberry-hand-pies-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/10/raspberry-hand-pies.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raspberry-hand-pies-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 cups whole wheat pastry flour or all-purpose flour", "&frac12; cup white whole wheat flour or regular whole wheat flour", "1 teaspoon salt", "2 sticks (1 cup) cold unsalted butter", "8 to 12 tablespoons ice water", "3 tablespoons maple syrup", "2 teaspoons arrowroot starch or 1 tablespoon cornstarch", "&frac12; teaspoon vanilla extract", "&frac12; teaspoon orange zest", "&frac14; teaspoon ground cinnamon", "2 packages (6 ounces each) Driscoll&#8217;s Raspberries", "1 egg, beaten", "&#8532; cup powdered sugar", "1 tablespoon fresh orange juice", "1 teaspoon maple syrup", "&frac12; teaspoon orange zest", "&frac14; teaspoon ground cinnamon", "&frac14; teaspoon salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the dough: In a medium mixing bowl, combine both flours and the salt, then whisk to blend. Slice one stick of butter down the center lengthwise, then rotate the butter a quarter turn and slice it down the center lengthwise again, so you have quartered the butter. Slice across the butter to make even cubes. Repeat with the remaining stick of butter. Toss about half of the cubed butter into the bowl.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raspberry-hand-pies-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Working quickly, squish each piece of butter between your fingers under the flour so it turns into a flat, irregularly shaped disc. Continue with remaining cubes, then add the rest and repeat. Grab handfuls of buttery flour in your palms and press to break up the butter just a bit more. Drizzle 4 tablespoons ice water over the mixture and stir to combine. Repeat with an additional 2 tablespoons ice water, stirring to combine, and again with another 2 tablespoons. Mix with a spoon until it starts coming together into a workable dough. The mixture should be moist enough that you can squeeze it between your palms and it will stick together; if it won&#8217;t, try adding another two tablespoons of water or more, just until the mixture sticks together. Divide the mixture into two equally sized halves.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raspberry-hand-pies-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place two square pieces of plastic wrap nearby, then shape each pie dough into a round disc about 5\u201d in diameter and wrap it tightly in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 3 days (this is necessary because cold butter is the key to a flaky crust!).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raspberry-hand-pies-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the filling: In a medium mixing bowl, combine the maple syrup, starch, vanilla extract, orange zest and cinnamon. Whisk until there are no clumps of starch remaining. Add the raspberries and gently toss with a spoon to coat the berries in a light, even layer. Place the bowl in the refrigerator to chill for now.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raspberry-hand-pies-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the hand pies: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit and line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. On a floured surface, use a rolling pin to roll half of the chilled pie dough into a circle about 12-inches across and between &#8539;\u201d to &frac14;\u201d thick. Use the top of a drinking glass 3 &frac12;\u201d in diameter (a working glass is perfect) to cut 12 circles. Re-roll the scraps if necessary. Carefully transfer each round to your prepared baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining pie dough.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raspberry-hand-pies-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Brush half of the rounds with egg wash, then top each of those rounds with a heaping tablespoon of raspberry filling (about 7 raspberries per hand pie). Place another round on top of each raspberry-covered round. With a fork, gently press down on the outer &frac14;\u201d of the rounds to seal the hand pies, working your way around until they are completely sealed. Gently poke a few holes on the top of each hand pie with the tines of your fork, then brush egg wash on top of each hand pie. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until the hand pies are deeply golden brown. Transfer the baking sheet to a cooling rack and let the hand pies cool for at least 30 minutes before glazing.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raspberry-hand-pies-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the glaze: In a small bowl, combine the powdered sugar, orange juice, maple syrup, orange zest, cinnamon and salt. Whisk until the mixture is well blended and completely smooth. It should be thick but pourable (if it\u2019s too thick to drizzle, mix in a bit more orange juice). Use a spoon to drizzle a striped pattern back and forth over the cooled hand pies. Wait for 5 to 10 minutes for the glaze to set and then serve! Leftover hand pies are best stored covered and refrigerated for up to 3 days.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/raspberry-hand-pies-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT1H30M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT2H", "recipeYield": ["12", "12 hand pies"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "6", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 hand pie", "calories": "298 calories", "sugarContent": "11.2 g", "sodiumContent": "251.7 mg", "fatContent": "16.1 g", "saturatedFatContent": "9.7 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "35.3 g", "fiberContent": "6.7 g", "proteinContent": "4 g", "cholesterolContent": "56 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Keri"}, "datePublished": "2015-12-08", "reviewBody": "Kate! Scrape down the bowl, then add the remaining edamame and process until the hummus is thick and quite smooth, about 1 to 2 minutes more. If your hummus is too thick or chunky, run the food processor while drizzling in 1 to 2 tablespoons more water, as necessary, until it reaches your desired consistency.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/edamame-hummus-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Taste and blend in additional salt if the hummus doesn&#8217;t taste awesome yet (I usually add another &frac14; teaspoon). Add the garlic and a pinch of red pepper flakes, stir, and cook for another 30 seconds. Add the zucchini, yellow squash and bell pepper. Cook, stirring often, until the squash is softened and cooked through but not mushy, about 7 minutes. Remove the pan from heat and squeeze the juice of &frac12; of a lime over the veggies. Thank you!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Becky"}, "datePublished": "2024-11-21", "reviewBody": "Okay, so the flavor of this was really good! But to my dismay, when I removed the foil, everything was very liquidy underneath and the brown top stuck to the foil. So I put the dish back in the oven for 10min uncovered hoping to get the brown top back again. Thankfully it did come back, but everything was still so liquidy despite the potatoes being tender. So then I covered with foil again for 5min, but made it a tent shape so the brown top wouldn\u2019t stick to it. Still lots of liquid underneath, so after those 5min covered, I removed the foil and finished it in the oven for 10min uncovered. I had made the risky decision to make this for the first time before a Friendsgiving dinner, so I ran out of time. The total time I baked was 65min (15min total covered), though I\u2019m wondering if I had done another 10-20 min uncovered if the liquid would have lessened/thickened. I tasted the dish and it was truly divine, I was just disappointed I didn\u2019t get a nice sliceable version like the pictures show. To me, it looked more like scalloped potatoes. \r\n\r\nSome differences to consider were that I prepped the dish earlier in the morning, so it was refrigerated prior, hence the longer bake time. And then I used Yukon Gold potatoes from Idaho instead of Russets. My cheese was a Gruy\u00e8re/Swiss blend from Private Selection brand (Kroger/Fry\u2019s).\r\n\r\nI think I would attempt to make this again, and just expect to cook it longer to rid of all the excess liquid. Thankfully it was still good enough for me to bring to the dinner and others enjoyed it as well. I feel like the sauce thickened more as it cooled down, though still not enough. I would just love to be able to get it to a consistency where it could actually be cut into squares vs scooping it out with a spoon. I know I rely heavily on reviews to help me troubleshoot recipes, so I hope this helps someone else! Thank you, Kate, for this recipe. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Steel-Cut Oat \"Risotto\" with Butternut Squash and Kale", "description": "This hearty risotto is made with steel-cut oats instead of rice! It\u2019s thick, creamy and rich like regular risotto, but with extra texture and nutty flavor, thanks to the oats. You\u2019re going to love it! Recipe yields 4 generous or 6 more modest servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Risotto, savory steel-cut oats, butternut squash", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/11/butternut-kale-steel-cut-oat-risotto-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/11/butternut-kale-steel-cut-oat-risotto-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/11/butternut-kale-steel-cut-oat-risotto-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/11/butternut-kale-steel-cut-oat-risotto-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/steel-cut-oat-risotto-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil\u00a0", "1 medium red onion, chopped", "1 small (2 pounds) butternut squash or 2 sweet potatoes, peeled and diced into &frac12;\u201d cubes", "1 teaspoon salt, divided, more to taste", "Pinch of red pepper flakes", "4 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "1 &frac12; cups steel-cut oats", "2 packed cups chopped kale, ribs removed (about &frac12; bunch)", "&frac12; cup dry white wine*\u00a0", "6 cups water\u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0\u00a0", "&frac34; cup (1 &frac34; ounces) freshly grated Parmesan cheese", "2 tablespoons butter", "1 tablespoon lemon juice\u00a0", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium Dutch oven or soup pot, warm the olive oil until shimmering. Add the onion, butternut, &frac12; teaspoon of the salt, and the red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring often, until the onion is translucent and the butternut is mostly tender, about 8 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/steel-cut-oat-risotto-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic and stir to combine. Add the oats and kale and cook, stirring often, until the kale has mostly wilted, about 2 minutes.\u00a0 Add the wine and use a wooden spoon or silicone spatula to scrape up any browned bits that have formed against the bottom of the pan. Cook, while stirring, for another 1 to 2 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/steel-cut-oat-risotto-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the water and remaining &frac12; teaspoon salt. Raise the heat to high and bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring occasionally. Once simmering, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is very creamy and thick (see photos), about 20 to 30 minutes. As time goes on, you might need to stir more frequently and reduce the heat to prevent scorching the bottom.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/steel-cut-oat-risotto-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the Parmesan, butter, lemon juice and several twists of black pepper. Let the risotto rest for 5 minutes before serving. Once you\u2019re ready to serve, season generously with additional salt (I usually add at least \u00bc teaspoon), and black pepper. Add an extra squeeze of lemon juice if it needs an extra boost of flavor. Recipe yields 8 small burritos.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash-2-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash-2-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash-2-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash-2-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil", "&frac12; sweet yellow onion, diced", "2 garlic cloves, pressed or minced", "&frac34; pound sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into &frac12;-inch or smaller cubes (to yield about 2 cups cubed sweet potato)", "1 red bell pepper, chopped", "&frac14; to &frac12; teaspoon smoked paprika", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "&frac14; teaspoon freshly ground pepper", "8 eggs", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "&frac14; teaspoon freshly ground pepper", "1 &frac12; teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil", "4 ounce log of goat cheese, at room temperature (or buy herbed goat cheese and omit the following herbs)", "&frac12; teaspoon dried basil", "&frac12; teaspoon dried parsley", "&frac14; teaspoon dried rosemary", "&frac14; teaspoon dried thyme", "1 can (14 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained, or 1 &frac12; cups cooked black beans", "8 8-inch whole grain tortillas", "Hot sauce, and/or salsa preferably a smoky/chipotle variety"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the hash: Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil, then the onion, and cook until the onion is slightly softened, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the garlic, sweet potato, red pepper, paprika, salt and pepper. Stir to combine, reduce heat to medium low, cover and cook until the sweet potato is tender, about 8 minutes. Uncover and continue cooking, stirring often, until the excess moisture has evaporated and the sweet potatoes are caramelized and golden on the edges. Carefully taste to make sure the sweet potatoes are cooked through. If desired, add more smoked paprika to taste.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To scramble the eggs: In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt and pepper. Heat another skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil, then pour the eggs into the skillet and stir constantly with a heatproof spatula until the eggs are just cooked (don&#8217;t overdo it!). Transfer the eggs to a bowl and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the goat cheese: (Skip this step if you bought herbed goat cheese.) In a small bowl, stir the dried herbs into the softened goat cheese (if you forgot to pull the cheese out the refrigerator until now, just zap it in the microwave for a few seconds to soften it).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the burritos: Spread about a tablespoon of goat cheese down the center of each tortilla. Top with a scoop of eggs, followed by black beans and sweet potato hash, equally dividing the ingredients between the burritos. Try not to overfill these!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make them freezer ready: Let the burritos cool to room temperature before proceeding (excess moisture trapped in plastic wrap will turn into freezer burn). Lay a square of plastic wrap on your work surface and place a prepared tortilla in the center. Fold one side of the tortilla over the burrito, then snugly pull the opposite side over to make a wrap. Pull one corner of the plastic wrap over the exposed end, then repeat with the opposite side and roll it up to tightly wrap the burrito. Transfer the wrapped burritos to a freezer-safe bag and squeeze out the air before sealing. Store the burritos in the freezer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To warm the burritos, remove from the freezer and microwave until warm, 30 to 60 seconds. If preferred, you could also warm them in an oven or toaster oven. Serve with plenty of hot sauce and/or salsa on the side.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-freezer-breakfast-burritos-with-sweet-potato-hash/#instruction-step-6"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT25M", "totalTime": "PT45M", "recipeYield": "8", "recipeCategory": "Breakfast", "recipeCuisine": "Mexican", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "41", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "347 calories", "sugarContent": "4.5 g", "sodiumContent": "716.5 mg", "fatContent": "14.4 g", "saturatedFatContent": "6 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "37.6 g", "fiberContent": "9.4 g", "proteinContent": "17.1 g", "cholesterolContent": "192.5 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "4"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Aike"}, "datePublished": "2015-05-17", "reviewBody": "Hi! This spicy, hearty, chickpea-based Indian dish is vegan and gluten free. It makes great leftovers, too! Be sure to prep the ingredients in advance, as the recipe moves quickly. Recipe yields 4 bowls.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "spicy Indian chickpeas with tomatoes", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/vegan-chana-masala-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/vegan-chana-masala-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/vegan-chana-masala-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/vegan-chana-masala-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-vegan-chana-masala/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup uncooked brown basmati rice, for serving (rice is optional, I like to cook extra to have on hand for other meals)", "2 tablespoons coconut oil or extra-virgin olive oil", "1 medium yellow onion, chopped", "1 medium serrano or jalape\u00f1o pepper*, minced (remove ribs and seeds to tame the spice level)", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt, to taste", "5 cloves garlic, pressed or minced (about 1 tablespoon)", "1 tablespoon peeled and minced fresh ginger (about a 1-inch piece)", "1 &frac12; teaspoons garam masala**", "1 &frac12; teaspoons ground coriander", "&frac34; teaspoon ground cumin", "&frac12; teaspoon ground turmeric", "Pinch of cayenne pepper (optional!*)", "1 large can (28 ounces) fire-roasted crushed tomatoes or whole peeled tomatoes, with their juices", "2 cans (14 ounces each) chickpeas (or 3 cups cooked chickpeas), rinsed and drained", "Lemon wedges, for garnish", "Fresh cilantro, for garnish (optional)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook the rice (if you want to serve the chana masala on rice): Bring a large pot of water to boil on the stove and rinse the rice in a fine-mesh colander. Once boiling, pour in the rice and give it a stir. Boil the rice for 30 minutes, then turn off the heat and drain the rice. Return the rice to the pot and cover the pot. Let the rice steam for 10 minutes. Remove the lid, fluff the rice with a fork and season with sea salt to taste.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-vegan-chana-masala/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook the chana masala: In a medium Dutch oven or large saucepan, warm the oil over medium-low heat. Add the onion, serrano and salt. Cook until the onion is tender and turning translucent, about 5 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-vegan-chana-masala/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic and ginger, and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds to 1 minute. Stir in the garam masala, coriander, cumin, turmeric, salt and cayenne (if using), and cook for another minute, while stirring constantly.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-vegan-chana-masala/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the tomatoes and their juices. If using whole tomatoes, use the back of a wooden spoon to break the tomatoes apart (you can leave some chunks of tomato for texture).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-vegan-chana-masala/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Raise the heat to medium-high and add the chickpeas. Bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook, reducing the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer, for 10 minutes or longer to allow the flavors to develop. Season to taste with additional salt, if desired. Recipe yields 4 moderate servings or 2 large.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/06/almond-sesame-soba-zoodles-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/06/almond-sesame-soba-zoodles-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/06/almond-sesame-soba-zoodles-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/06/almond-sesame-soba-zoodles-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/almond-sesame-soba-zoodles-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["8 ounces soba noodles", "1 bunch of radishes (about 6 medium), cut into &frac12;-inch cubes", "1 large cucumber (about 1 pound), cut into &frac12;-inch cubes", "&frac14; cup rice vinegar", "2 teaspoons fine sea salt, divided", "&frac12; cup unsalted almond butter", "1 small garlic clove, pressed or minced", "&frac14; cup freshly squeezed lime juice (about 2 limes)", "2 tablespoons reduced-sodium tamari or soy sauce", "2 teaspoons raw honey", "2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil", "&frac14; cup water, more as necessary", "2 large zucchini (about 1 pound), spiralized into thin noodles", "1 tablespoon sesame seeds, preferably black, for garnish", "Sriracha or chili-garlic sauce, for serving"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Transfer the noodles to a large serving bowl and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/almond-sesame-soba-zoodles-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the noodles are cooking, in a medium mixing bowl, combine the radishes, cucumber, vinegar and 1 teaspoon of the salt. Let the veggies marinate for 10 minutes, tossing occasionally.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/almond-sesame-soba-zoodles-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "(Phoebe did this step in a food processor but I opted to whisk together by hand.) In a 2-cup liquid measuring cup, combine the almond butter, garlic, lime juice, tamari, honey, sesame oil and remaining 1 teaspoon salt. Whisk until blended, then add &frac14; cup water and blend again. If necessary, add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until you reach the consistency of peanut sauce.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/almond-sesame-soba-zoodles-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the sauce into the mixing bowl with the soba noodles. Add the zucchini noodles and toss until everything is well coated. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Seriously Good Vegetable Soup", "description": "This vegetable soup recipe is seriously so good! It's easy to make, and full of veggies and fresh flavor. If you're feeing under the weather or just wanting to lighten up your meals, this soup is the answer. Recipe yields 6 bowls of soup.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "vegetable soup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/11/vegetable-soup-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/11/vegetable-soup-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/11/vegetable-soup-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2019/11/vegetable-soup-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-soup-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "1 medium yellow or white onion, chopped", "3 carrots, peeled and chopped", "2 celery stalks, chopped", "2 cups chopped seasonal vegetables, such as sweet potatoes, green beans, butternut squash, potatoes, bell pepper, zucchini or yellow squash", "1 teaspoon fine sea salt, divided, to taste", "6 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac12; teaspoon curry powder", "&frac12; teaspoon dried thyme", "1 large can (28 ounces) diced tomatoes", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth", "2 cups water", "2 bay leaves", "&frac12; teaspoon red pepper flakes, reduce or omit if sensitive to spice", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "2 cups chopped kale or collard greens or chard (thick ribs removed), or spinach", "1 tablespoon lemon juice"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Warm 3 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large Dutch oven or soup pot over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the chopped onion, carrot, celery, seasonal vegetables and &frac12; teaspoon of the salt. Cook, stirring often, until the onion has softened and is turning translucent, about 6 to 8 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic, curry powder and thyme. Cook until fragrant while stirring frequently, about 1 minute. Pour in the diced tomatoes with their juices and cook for a few more minutes, stirring often.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour in the broth and water. Add &frac12; teaspoon more salt, 2 bay leaves and the red pepper flakes. Season generously with freshly ground black pepper. Raise the heat and bring the mixture to a boil, then partially cover the pot and reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook for 25 minutes, then remove the lid and add the chopped greens. Continue simmering for 5 minutes or more, until the greens have softened to your liking.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetable-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from heat and remove the bay leaves. Stir in the lemon juice and remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Taste and season with more salt, pepper and/or red pepper flakes. (You might need up to \u00bd teaspoon more salt, depending on your vegetable broth and your personal preferences.) Working in batches, pulse the chunks in a food processor with the S-blade until they&#8217;re broken into tiny pieces, just bigger than couscous. (See recipe notes if you don&#8217;t have a food processor.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cauliflower-rice-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Wrap the cauliflower rice in a clean tea towel or paper towels, twist, and squeeze as much water as possible from the rice\u2014you might be surprised by how much water you can wring out, or you might not be. Add the olive oil, followed by the garlic. Cook while stirring just until the garlic is fragrant, about 10 to 20 seconds. Add the cauliflower rice and salt, and stir to combine. Cook, stirring just every minute or so, until the cauliflower rice is hot and turning golden in places, about 6 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/cauliflower-rice-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the skillet from the heat. Stir in the chopped fresh herbs and citrus, if using. Season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve warm. Leftover cauliflower rice will keep well in the fridge for up to 4 days. I make cauliflower rice all the time and my family can\u2019t even tell it\u2019s not rice ( and we are talking teenagers and hubby). I wizz up the cauliflower in a thermomix not to fine,  and simply cook it in a wok on high with some oil. I have never ever squeezed out the water first and to be honest there is no need to as it fried up perfect in a wok on high, never wet. I also freeze bags of the raw rice and when time to use I break up the frozen cauliflower rice chunks with a hammer and throw straight into a hot wok still frozen. I never ever defrost the frozen cauliflower as it is then a soggy wet  mess before frying. Once cooked to my liking ( dont over cook the rice so it\u2019s too soft),  I then add whatever already cooked fried rice ingredients and sauces for perfect low carb fried rice. I make Korean kimichi rice, use in burrito bowls and a heap of rice dishes perfectly. Because this is all veggie I occasionally  add into the final cooked batch of cauliflower rice, a packet of store bought white or brown microwave rice,  just to bulk it a little with  more carbs for my husband. If you had small kids, doing this would trick them completely and they would have no idea their fried rice is 1/2-3/4 cauliflower!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lillian"}, "datePublished": "2021-08-18", "reviewBody": "Just a note in the event no one has tried a great way of prepping the cauliflower for ricing. Recipe yields 6 cups beans (the equivalent of 4 cans); you can freeze leftovers or cut the recipe in half.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "pantry friendly, healthy", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/07/best-black-beans-recipe-2-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/07/best-black-beans-recipe-2-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/07/best-black-beans-recipe-2-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/07/best-black-beans-recipe-2-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-black-beans-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 pound (16 ounces or scant 2 &frac12; cups) dried black beans*", "1 medium red onion, chopped", "4 medium cloves garlic, peeled but left whole", "2 bay leaves", "1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil", "1 teaspoon fine sea salt", "1 teaspoon ground cumin", "One strip of orange zest, about 2 inches long by &frac12; inch wide", "&frac12; teaspoon red pepper flakes (omit or reduce if sensitive to spice)", "8 cups water**, more if needed", "2 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro, optional", "1 tablespoon lime juice"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, pick through your black beans for debris (sometimes tiny rocks can sneak in). Place the beans in a fine mesh colander or sieve and rinse very well. Pour the beans into a large Dutch oven or saucepan (4 quarts or larger in capacity).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-black-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the onion, garlic, bay leaves, olive oil, salt, cumin, orange zest and red pepper flakes (if using) to the pot. Pour in the water.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-black-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the pot and bring it to a boil over high heat. Remove the lid and reduce the heat to low to maintain a gentle simmer. Give the beans a stir to make sure none are stuck to the bottom of the pot, and set a timer for 1 hour. Leave the pot uncovered and adjust the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer (you should see several small bubbles popping to the surface at any given moment).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-black-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the timer goes off, test a couple of beans by using a fork to press them against the side of the pot. If they&#8217;re easy to press through, taste a few (carefully! they&#8217;re hot!) to see if they&#8217;re sufficiently plump, tender and delicious.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-black-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Otherwise, continue cooking, testing in 15 to 30 minute intervals as needed, until they&#8217;re done. If you&#8217;re running low on liquid, add water in 1-cup increments so the beans are covered at all time. (As mentioned in the post, if your beans are old, they can take several hours to cook and require a lot more water, and some very old beans may never cook through.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-black-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the beans are very tender and tasty, you can increase the heat a little to reduce the cooking liquid into a more gravy-like consistency, about 5 to 15 minutes (it will continue to thicken up as the beans cool).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-black-beans-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from the heat. Carefully remove the orange zest and both bay leaves. Use a fork to press the garlic against the side of the bowl to break it up. Add the cilantro, if using, and lime juice. Stir to combine. Season to taste with additional salt, if needed. small cauliflower\u2014you can grate it on the holes of a large box grater or finely slice it on a mandoline, then roughly chop)", "2 cups finely chopped purple cabbage (about &frac12; small cabbage)", "1 pint (2 cups) cherry tomatoes, quartered", "1 small cucumber, halved, seeded and thinly sliced (no need to peel)", "1 small red onion, chopped", "&#8532; cup crumbled feta cheese", "2 ripe avocados (thinly slice just before serving)", "&frac12;\u00a0cup extra-virgin olive oil", "&frac12;\u00a0cup lime juice (from about 4 limes)", "&frac12; cup lightly packed cilantro (mostly leaves)", "1 small jalape\u00f1o, seeds and ribs removed, and roughly chopped", "1 tablespoon tahini (optional, for a more creamy dressing)", "1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup", "1 teaspoon ground cumin", "&frac12;\u00a0teaspoon Dijon mustard", "1 clove garlic, roughly chopped", "&frac14;\u00a0teaspoon fine sea salt", "Pinch of red pepper flakes (optional, for extra heat)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "First, toast the pepitas: combine the pepitas, olive oil, chili powder and a pinch of salt in a medium skillet over medium heat. Starting on a low speed and working up to higher speeds, cream the mixture until fluffy. I used a handheld mixer for this.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/lemon-curd-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While beating the mixture, slowly add the egg yolks and eggs. Then, add the zest and lemon juice to the bowl and blend again. It will look curdled at this point, but don&#8217;t worry!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/lemon-curd-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the mixture into a medium-sized, non-reactive saucepan (stainless steel or enameled cast iron should work great). Cook over medium-low heat while stirring constantly with a rubber spatula or wooden spoon (it\u2019s important to stir constantly throughout the cooking process, which will take somewhere between 10 to 20 minutes).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/lemon-curd-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the mixture starts looking smooth and shiny, slowly increase the heat to medium. Continue cooking until the mixture has thickened and your spoon meets resistance as you stir, which happens right at the brink of boiling. Once the mixture is trying to boil, cook for about 15 more seconds while stirring constantly, then remove from heat. The curd will thicken up more as it cools.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/lemon-curd-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the curd cool before transferring it to an airtight container and screwing on a lid. Recipe yields a lot of soup (about 12 cups), and leftovers freeze well.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Roasted Red Pepper and Tomato Soup, summer", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2011/10/roasted-red-pepper-tomato-soup-in-bowls-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2011/10/roasted-red-pepper-tomato-soup-in-bowls-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2011/10/roasted-red-pepper-tomato-soup-in-bowls-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2011/10/roasted-red-pepper-tomato-soup-in-bowls.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-red-pepper-and-tomato-soup/", "recipeIngredient": ["8 to 9 medium tomatoes (about 5 pounds), cored and quartered", "3 red bell peppers (about 1 pound), seeded and quartered", "2 small yellow onions, cut into wedges about &frac34;&#8243; wide on the outer edges", "2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided", "6 cloves garlic, unpeeled", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth", "&frac14; teaspoon smoked paprika", "Pinch of cayenne pepper (omit if sensitive to spice)", "Fine salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit with racks in the upper third and middle of the oven. Line two large, rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-red-pepper-and-tomato-soup/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the tomatoes on one of the prepared baking sheets. Place the bell peppers and onions on the other baking sheet. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-red-pepper-and-tomato-soup/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gently toss the onions and red peppers until they are lightly coated in oil (try to keep the onion wedges intact as best you can). Position the red peppers with the skin sides facing down. Place the unpeeled garlic cloves on the sheet, too.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-red-pepper-and-tomato-soup/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the tomatoes on the top rack of the oven and the peppers and onion on the middle rack. Peel your garlic and toss it in. Add the roasted vegetables, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, if using, and &frac14; teaspoon salt. Simmer for 10 minutes, reducing heat as necessary to maintain a steady simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-red-pepper-and-tomato-soup/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pur\u00e9e the soup using an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender in batches, several cups at a time. Thank you!!!\r\n\r\nI have been organic for over fifty years and I am most discerning when it comes to good veggies.\r\n\r\nI roasted heirloom tomatoes and red bell peppers  and the soup had a very bitter taste. I think it was from the bell peppers as they did not taste sweet raw. These lightened-up vegetarian enchiladas include black beans, a modest amount of sour cream and some golden cheese on top. Recipe yields 6 large enchiladas. You might as well make a double batch of the sauce and freeze it for later!", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/05/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas-recipe-1-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/05/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas-recipe-1-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/05/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas-recipe-1-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/05/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas-recipe-1-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons olive oil", "3 tablespoons whole wheat or all-purpose flour", "2 teaspoons ground chili powder", "1 teaspoon cumin", "&frac12; teaspoon garlic powder", "&frac14; teaspoon dried oregano", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "&#8539; teaspoon ground cinnamon", "2 tablespoons tomato paste", "2 cups vegetable broth", "1 teaspoon apple cider vinegar or distilled white vinegar", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "2 tablespoons olive oil", "1 cup chopped red onion (about 1 small red onion)", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "4 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "1 heaping cup drained artichokes (either jarred or defrosted frozen), quartered if necessary", "1 (4-ounce) can green chilis, drained", "12 ounces baby spinach, preferably organic", "1 (15-ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed", "&frac14; cup sour cream", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "6 (8-inch) whole wheat tortillas", "1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese", "Handful chopped cilantro, for garnish"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before you make the sauce, measure the flour and spices into a small bowl and place your tomato paste near the stove. In a medium-sized pot over medium heat, warm the oil until shimmering (it should be warm enough that the spices sizzle on contact). Pour in the flour and spice mixture. While stirring constantly with a whisk, cook until fragrant and slightly deepened in color, about 1 minute. Whisk the tomato paste into the mixture, then slowly pour in the broth while whisking constantly to remove any lumps.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer, whisking often, for about five minutes, until the sauce has thickened a bit and a spoon encounters some resistance as you stir it. (The sauce will further thicken as it cools.) Remove from heat, then whisk in the vinegar and season to taste with a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make your enchiladas, preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit with racks in the middle position and upper third. Lightly grease a 13 by 9-inch pan.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet, warm 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the chopped onion and &frac14; teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring often, until the onion is tender and translucent, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the drained artichokes and green chilis to the skillet, then add a few large handfuls of spinach. Cook, stirring and tossing frequently, until the spinach has wilted. Repeat with remaining spinach. Continue cooking, stirring frequently, until the pan is no longer wet with excess moisture. Remove from heat and transfer the mixture to a bowl. Stir in the drained black beans and sour cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour &frac12; cup enchilada sauce into your prepared pan and tilt it from side to side until the bottom of the pan is evenly coated. To assemble your first enchilada, spread &frac12; cup spinach artichoke mixture down the middle of a tortilla, then snugly wrap the left side over and then the right, to make a wrap. Place it seam side down against the edge of your pan. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Drizzle the remaining enchilada sauce evenly over the enchiladas, leaving the very ends of the enchiladas bare. Sprinkle shredded cheese evenly over the enchiladas.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/spinach-artichoke-enchiladas/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake, uncovered, on the middle rack for 20 minutes. Add more vinaigrette if necessary to lightly coat the arugula (I only needed about half of mine and saved the rest for a future salad). Ready in under 10 minutes! For a more pantry-friendly option, use walnuts/pecans instead of hemp seeds and/or olive oil for the flaxseed oil (it's just as tasty). Recipe yields about 1 1/4 cups pesto.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/03/kale-hemp-and-flax-oil-pesto-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/03/kale-hemp-and-flax-oil-pesto-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/03/kale-hemp-and-flax-oil-pesto-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/03/kale-hemp-and-flax-oil-pesto.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/super-kale-pesto-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 to 3 cloves garlic", "3 cups packed kale (about 1 small bunch)", "&frac34; cup hemp seeds or toasted walnuts or pecans", "2 tablespoons lemon juice (about 1 lemon)", "&frac34; teaspoon fine-grain sea salt", "&frac14; teaspoon ground pepper", "Red pepper flakes, optional (if you want to add some kick)", "&frac14; cup flaxseed oil or extra-virgin olive oil (more if desired)", "Entirely optional: &#8531; cup grated Parmesan cheese", "1 pound (16 ounces) whole grain pasta, like linguine", "1 cup reserved pasta water"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the pesto: In a food processor, add the peeled garlic cloves and process until the garlic is minced. Add the kale, hemp seeds, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Turn on the food processor and drizzle in the oil. Process until the pesto reaches your desired consistency, stopping to scrape down the sides as necessary. Taste and add more lemon, salt or pepper if necessary. (You can thin out the pesto with more oil, but if you\u2019re serving with pasta, keep in mind that you can also thin it out with reserved pasta cooking water.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/super-kale-pesto-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook the pasta (optional): Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add the pasta and cook until al dente, according to package directions. Reserve one cup cooking liquid before draining the pasta. Let the pasta and pasta water cool for a minute to make sure the high heat doesn&#8217;t damage the flax oil pesto.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/super-kale-pesto-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you intend to have leftovers, transfer the amount of pasta you think you\u2019ll be eating immediately to a serving bowl and mix in pesto with splashes of cooking water. Otherwise, you can mix the pasta and pesto together in your cooking pot, adding splashes of cooking water as necessary. Keep in mind that you have diluted the flavor a bit with the cooking water, so taste and add more lemon, salt or a drizzle of olive oil as necessary.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/super-kale-pesto-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "PT8M", "totalTime": "PT13M", "recipeYield": ["1", "1 1/4 cups"], "recipeCategory": "Entree", "cookingMethod": "Food processor", "recipeCuisine": "Italian", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "92", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "440 calories", "sugarContent": "2.2 g", "sodiumContent": "372.3 mg", "fatContent": "22.3 g", "saturatedFatContent": "3.4 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "47.6 g", "fiberContent": "7.3 g", "proteinContent": "17.1 g", "cholesterolContent": "4 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cat"}, "datePublished": "2020-10-11", "reviewBody": "This recipe is great! Or some sort of spice?  I have a basil pesto recipe I love that calls for almonds and a dash of nutmeg that is my go-to.  Is there an herb or spice that would complement the parsley like the nutmeg does for the basil? Thanks!\r\n\r\nLoretta\r\n\r\nTIP:  I like to warm my garlic in the olive oil on very low heat for just a minute or so and then let it cool before adding it to the pesto. Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the bay leaf, black beans, tomatoes and their juices and broth. Stir to combine and cover for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Taste about halfway through cooking and add more chopped chipotle peppers if you&#8217;d like.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-chipotle-chili-with-avocado/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "You\u2019ll know your chili is done when the butternut squash is nice and tender, and the liquid has reduced a bit, producing the hearty chili consistency we all know and love. Warm a drizzle of olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat until shimmering. Toss in the tortilla slices, sprinkle with salt, and stir. Cook until the strips are crispy and turning golden, stirring occasionally, about 4 to 7 minutes. It's gluten free, too! Recipe yields one 9-inch square eggplant Parm, or about 8 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/10/best-eggplant-parmesan-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/10/best-eggplant-parmesan-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/10/best-eggplant-parmesan-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/10/best-eggplant-parmesan-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 pounds eggplants (about 3 smallish or 2 medium)", "&frac14; cup + 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided", "Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper", "1 medium yellow onion, finely chopped", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "&frac14; cup tomato paste", "28 ounces crushed tomatoes, preferably the fire-roasted variety*\u00a0\u00a0", "&frac14; cup roughly chopped fresh basil, plus additional basil for garnish", "1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar", "Pinch of red pepper flakes", "6 ounces freshly grated part-skim mozzarella cheese (about 1 &frac12; cups, packed)", "2 ounces freshly grated Parmesan cheese (about 1 cup)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To roast the eggplant: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit with racks in the lower and upper thirds of the oven. Line two large rimmed, baking sheets with parchment paper for easy cleanup.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slice off both rounded ends on one eggplant, then stand it up on its widest flat side. Slice through the eggplant vertically to make long, even slabs &frac14;- to &frac12;-inch-thick. Discard both of the sides that are covered in eggplant skin. Repeat with the other eggplant(s).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Brush both sides of the eggplant slabs lightly with olive oil (you&#8217;ll likely need about &frac14; cup oil). Arrange them in a single layer on the prepared baking sheets. Sprinkle the top sides with\u00a0a few dashes of salt and pepper. Roast until golden and tender, about 22 to 27 minutes\u2014halfway through baking, rotate the pans 180 degrees and swap their positions (move pan on lower rack to upper rack, and vice versa). The pan on the lower rack might need a few extra minutes in the oven to turn golden. Set aside.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, to make the tomato sauce: In a medium saucepan over medium heat, warm 2 tablespoons olive oil until shimmering. Add the onion and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is very tender and translucent, about 4 to 7 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the garlic and tomato paste. Cook, while stirring, about 1 minute. Add the crushed tomatoes, stir to combine, and bring the mixture to a simmer. Once simmering, reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the sauce has thickened nicely, about 15 minutes. Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the chopped basil, vinegar, salt and red pepper flakes. Taste, and add more salt if necessary (I usually add another &frac14; teaspoon).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When you\u2019re ready to assemble, spread about &frac34; cup of the sauce in the bottom of a 9\u201d square baker. Arrange about one-third of the eggplant slices over the sauce, overlapping slightly (cut them to fit, if necessary). Spoon another &frac34; cup of the sauce over the eggplant and sprinkle with &frac14; cup mozzarella cheese.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Arrange about half of the remaining eggplant slices evenly on top. Spread another &frac34; cup sauce on top and sprinkle with &frac14; cup mozzarella cheese.\u00a0Layer the remaining eggplant slices on top and top with &frac34; cup sauce (you might have a little left over) and the remaining mozzarella cheese. Evenly sprinkle the Parmesan on top.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake on the lower rack at 425 degrees Fahrenheit, uncovered, until the sauce bubbles and the top is golden, about 20 to 25 minutes. Let it cool for at least 15 minutes to give it time to set, then chop and sprinkle additional basil on top. Slice with a sharp knife and serve.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/italian-eggplant-parmesan-recipe/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Leftovers keep well, covered and refrigerated, for about 4 days. You can also melt the chocolate over a double boiler or in a glass bowl over gently simmering water. Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat. In the meantime, melt the coconut oil (or butter) in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Once shimmering, add the oats and cook, stirring occasionally, until golden and fragrant, around 2 minutes. This toasting step greatly enhances the flavor of the oats.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/perfect-steel-cut-oats-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir the oats into the simmering liquid. Reduce the heat to medium-low, adjusting as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mixture is very thick.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/perfect-steel-cut-oats-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the salt. Continue to simmer the mixture, stirring occasionally and reducing heat as necessary to prevent scorching on the bottom, until almost all of the liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes. (If you doubled the recipe, your oatmeal might need an extra 5 minutes cooking time here.) The oatmeal will be very creamy when it&#8217;s done.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/perfect-steel-cut-oats-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from heat and stir in any mix-ins that you&#8217;d like.
